get.summary: Retrieve the keycloak JSON configuration (for use by the UI)
Retrieve JSON describing the add-ons that are available on the system
Aggregate javascript content for all add-ons and format as a single Javascript stream (this gives the UI a static URL to load add-on logic)
Retrieve a listing of the artifact stores available on the system. This is especially useful for setting up a network of Indy instances that reference one another
Retrieve a list of the package type names (eg. maven, npm, generic-http, etc) available on the system.
Retrieve a mapping of the package type names to descriptors (eg. maven, npm, generic-http, etc) available on the system.
Retrieve versioning information about this Indy instance

head.summary: Store file/artifact content under the given artifact store (type/name) and path.

200.description: Header metadata for content (or rendered listing when path ends with '/index.html' or '/'

put.summary: Store file/artifact content under the given artifact store (type/name) and path.

400.description: No appropriate storage location was found in the specified store (this store, or a member if a group is specified).

delete.summary: Delete file/artifact content under the given artifact store (type/name) and path.

allOf.description: Grouping of other artifact stores, with a defined order to the membership that determines content preference

prefetch_priority.description: Integer to indicate the pre-fetching priority of the remote, higher means more eager to do the pre-fetching of the content in the repo, 0 or below means disable the pre-fecthing.

prefetch_rescan.description: Indicates if the remote needs to do rescan after prefetch

prefetch_listing_type.description: The prefetch listing type, should be html or koji

allOf.description: Proxy to a remote server's artifact content, with local cache storage.

validatorErrors.description: Mapping of rule name to error message for any failing validations

key.description: Session key (specified by the user) to track this record.

results.description: Results for all stores where repair was attempted, including failures

BatchDeleteRequest.description: Request of batch files that will be removed from the repository. Specifying the folo trackingID for removing the files uploaded through it, and that's supported in folo client only.

storeKey.description: The Indy key for the repository/group this where content was stored.

accessChannel.description: Type of content access, whether "normal" content API or generic HTTP proxy.

originUrl.description: If resolved from a remote repository, this is the origin URL, otherwise empty/null.

localUrl.description: URL to this path on the local Indy instance.

exception.description: Exception object if failed because of exception

source.description: Koji repository key to repair (formatted as: '{maven}:{remote,group}:name')

dryRun.description: Get repair report ONLY, not modify anything.

sections.description: Set of sections each corresponding an artifact store

not-found cache.description: Listing of artifact store paths that could not be retrieved.

async.description: Asynchronous call. A callback url is needed when it is true.

callback.description: Callback which is used to send the promotion result.

source.description: Indy store/repository key to promote FROM (formatted as: '{maven, npm}:{remote,hosted,group}:name')

targetGroup.description: Name of the Indy target group to promote TO (MUST be pre-existing)

target.description: Indy store/repository key to promote TO (formatted as: '{maven, npm}:{hosted,group}:name')

dryRun.description: Run validations, verify source and target locations ONLY, do not modify anything!

not-found cache info.description: Get NFC cache information, e.g., size, etc.

key.description: Serialized store key, of the form: '[hosted|group|remote]:name'

paths.description: paths that failed retrieval within this store (may be empty)

not-found cache section.description: Listing of paths that could not be retrieved for a given artifact store

overwrite.description: Whether to overwrite pre-existing artifact stores on the local Indy instance with definitions from the remote system

apiUrl.description: The URL to the remote Indy instance

actions.description: The list of replication actions to be performed

ReplicationDTO.description: Configuration for replicating the content stores on a remote Indy system

key.description: Serialized store key, of the form: '[hosted|group|remote]:name'

disable_timeout.description: Integer time in seconds which is used for repo automatically re-enable when set disable by errors, positive value means time in seconds, -1 means never disable, empty or 0 means use default timeout.

ArtifactStore.description: Definition of a content store on Indy, whether it proxies content from a remote server, hosts artifacts on this system, or groups other content stores.

validations.description: Result of validation rule executions, if applicable

readonly.description: identify if the hoste repo is readonly

allOf.description: Hosts artifact content on the local system
